intro: Pouteria gallifructa, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or araçá, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces bright red, fleshy berries that are rich in antioxidants and commonly consumed as a fruit. Its wood is also valued for its durability and is used in furniture and construction. Pouteria gallifructa plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting various wildlife species.
